 7:07 24May2005 RTRS-IRAQ AL QAEDA SAYS LEADER ZARQAWI WOUNDED, URGES PRAYERS - WEB SITE
 17:15 24May2005 RTRS-Iraq Qaeda says Zarqawi wounded, urges prayers-Web
 
 DUBAI, May 24 (Reuters) - Al Qaeda's group in Iraq said on Tuesday its leader Abu Musab al-Zarqawi had been wounded and urged Muslims to pray for him, according to a Web posting.
 "O nation of Islam... Pray for the healing of our Sheikh Abu Musab al-Zarqawi from an injury he suffered in the path of God," said a statement from the Al Qaeda Organistion for Holy War in Iraq. It's authenticity could not be verified.
 
 ((Editing by Stephen Weeks; Gulf newsroom, +971 4 391 8301, fax +971 4 391 8335, dubai.newsroom@reuters.com))
